name: Dangerous Grounds Minesweeper
description:
The first game I actually made ready to play. Uses math to disarm landmines.  Absolutely nothing special, just to teach me the basics in gamemaking.

Thought someone more than me would think it was fun so why not upload it to the public. 

Download and test, feel free to comment on what you think about it.

Game information:

Find and disarm all landmines on the field as fast as possible.

When the dice roll 3 or 6, choose between seeing any adjacent landmines to find them faster and lose the steps or choose not to show adjacent landmines and walk the steps instead.

When you land on a landmine, you need to figure out the answer to the math question and choose the correct answer. Correct answer, disarms the landmine, wrong answer explodes the landmine.

Use the numbers around the player to figure out where landmines are located.

The math questions become more difficult the higher the difficulty level you choose.

The speed for choosing the correct answer to the mathematics question also changes at the different levels of difficulty.
